results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Barbara Boyle, Michael Taylor, Richard Lerner, Brian Doubleday, Christina Steinberg and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: This psychological thriller is about an anthropologist, Ethan Powell, who leaves human society to live among gorillas. Fully ensconced in this animal world, Powell is extradited back to the United States after murdering two gorilla poachers. Once there, it falls to an ambitious psychiatrist to discover the non-communicative Powell’s secrets. With in-form performances by Anthony Hopkins and Cuba Gooding Jr, this film attempts with profundity to address human nature, harmony with the natural world, and what motivates passions bordering on insanity. Cast also includes Donald Sutherland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, Barbara Boyle, Michael Taylor, Richard Lerner, Brian Doubleday, Christina Steinberg and Jon Turteltaub

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: James McCloy, Brenda Horsfield and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Man in the Making”.
The relationship between animal mothers and their young is built up by a series of complex instinctive responses, and today some scientists see similar kinds of behaviour patterns in human mothers and babies. The first almost automatic smile of a baby may be a simple instinctive action which plays an important part in its development. Children reared in an institution tend to lapse into a state of withdrawal. Speakers include: Dr Mavis Gunther, Dr R.A. Hinde and Dr J.A. Ambrose.

results.title: Instant arson: testing firebombs and incendiaries
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of arson with firebombs and chemical incendiaries as ignition sources, and demonstrates different methods of extinguishing the resulting fire.

results.title: Inspired
results.brief_description:
Aaron Purnell used to suffer with up to 200 seizures a day. When he elected to have an operation that would stop his seizures, Aaron also knew that he would also end up with a permanent disability. This is his story of living with that disability, his involvement with the Whitehorse Disability Awareness Project and how his best friend Alisha inspired him to make something of his life.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.creator_credit: Jean Chalopin, P. Loubert and Bruno Bianchi

results.title: Inspector Gadget
results.creator_credit: Caravan Pictures, Walt Disney Productions, Roger Birnbaum, Andy Heyward, Jordan Kerner and David Kellogg
results.brief_description: A remake of the popular children’s animated TV series, this family oriented comedy, traces Gadget’s history as a mild-mannered security guard, reborn as super-detective, Inspector Gadget, able to foil criminals with his innumerable tools - which due to a freak incident - are now a part of his body. Gadget seeks to bring down the evil Dr Claw, (played with charm by Rupert Everett) - the man responsible for his transformation. Also stars Joely Fisher as Gadget’s romantic interest and Matthew Broderick as Inspector Gadget.

results.title: Insomnia (2002)
results.creator_credit: Alcon Entertainment, Witt Thomas Section Eight Productions, Paul Junger Witt, Edward McDonnell, Broderick Johnson, Andrew A Kosove and Christopher Nolan
results.brief_description: A police detective (Al Pacino) wanted for questioning by Internal Affairs flies to Alaska to assist in a murder enquiry. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer (Robin Williams) to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. An earnest young police detective (Hilary Swank) is thorough in her investigative techniques and discovers the truth. Based on the film “Insomnia” directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg, this all-star version is just as compelling. Cast includes Martin Donovan, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Insomnia (1997)
results.creator_credit: Norsk Film, Nordic Screen Production AS, Petter Borgli, Tomas Backstrom, Tom Remlov and Erik Skjoldbjaerg
results.brief_description: Edgy police thriller set in Norway and the original version of this title. A police detective (Stellan Skarsgard) is flown in from Sweeden to a small rural town in Norway to help solve the murder of a teenage schoolgirl. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. Tense and brooding the film questions the role of police as the enforcers of the law when they themselves are not above its constructs. Co-written and directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg this is a compelling first-time feature. Cast includes Sverre Anker Ousdal, Bjorn Floberg, Gisken Armand, Maria Bonnevie.
